intro: Leucopogon reflexus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. Leucopogon reflexus is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions.
